title: The original binge-watcher: why Marion Stokes spent 33 years glued to her TV
text:
Communist sympathiser, wealthy eccentric, FBI target, paranoid recluse – who was Marion Stokes, and why did she record television non-stop for three decades? Cal Revely-Calder spoke to the director of an extraordinary new documentary

On November 4 1979, during the Iran hostage crisis, Marion Stokes put a blank tape into her VCR and began to record the news. When the tape ran out, she replaced it. She continued to do this without a break for another 33 years.

Stokes, a lifelong socialist, had considerable wealth, thanks both to her second husband John (a millionaire) and their investment in the first round of Apple stocks. The couple lived in semi-seclusion in Philadelphia, attended by a secretary,...
